title: 1991 CONCACAF Gold Cup Final
text:
The 1991 CONCACAF Gold Cup Final was a <a href="association%20football">football</a> match played on 7 July 1991 at the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Memorial%20Coliseum">Memorial Coliseum</a> in <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a>, to determine the winner of the <a href="1991%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">1991 CONCACAF Gold Cup</a>. <a href="United%20States%20men%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">United States</a> beat <a href="Honduras%20national%20football%20team">Honduras</a> 4–3 on <a href="penalty%20shootout%20%28association%20football%29">penalties</a> after the game finished 0–0 after <a href="Overtime%20%28sports%29%23Association%20football">extra time</a>. This was the United States' first major title. It was also the first ever Gold Cup Final and first to be decided by a penalty shoot-out. As Gold Cup champion, the United States represented <a href="CONCACAF">CONCACAF</a> at the <a href="1992%20King%20Fahd%20Cup">1992 King Fahd Cup</a> in <a href="Saudi%20Arabia">Saudi Arabia</a>.
